newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton market closed for local holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton market closed for local holiday.

text.p: India's cotton market was closed on Thursday for the Parsi New Year, dealers said.
They said the market will reopen on Friday.

On Wednesday, cotton prices were steady in a narrow price band. "Overall market sentimentS for cotton was subdued on reports of the commencement of new crop arrivals in some southern states," one dealer said.
"New crop arrivals will gradually rise next month and will pick up in October," he said.
